intro: Fuchsia microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf fuchsia, is a species native to South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with compact, evergreen foliage. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn. Fuchsia microphylla is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and as a houseplant.
